blah_1977 wrote:
 > Is there a way to dynamically add a seed to be crawled to a crawl job
 > that is already running? (rather than creating a new crawl job to be
 > scheduled to run after the current crawl job has finished)

There are two ways:

1. Add it to the seeds file, pause, edit the configuration, make sure 
reread-seeds-on-config and rebuild-on-reconfig are set to true, click 
"finished" and unpause the crawler.

2. use JMX

e.g.
$ java -jar ./heritrix/bin/cmdline-jmxclient-0.10.5.jar 
controlRole:password localhost:8849

there should be a line in there listing the bean representing the crawl 
job, e.g.
org.archive.crawler:host=ubuntu,jmxport=8849,mother=Heritrix,name=hi5-meetup-20070426221727670,type=CrawlService.Job

$ java -jar ./heritrix/bin/cmdline-jmxclient-0.10.5.jar 
controlRole:password localhost:8849 
org.archive.crawler:host=ubuntu,jmxport=8849,mother=Heritrix,name=hi5-meetup-20070426221727670,type=CrawlService.Job

should give you a list of possible commands and parameters they take. 
To add a seed,

$ java -jar ./heritrix/bin/cmdline-jmxclient-0.10.5.jar 
controlRole:password localhost:8849 
org.archive.crawler:host=ubuntu,jmxport=8849,mother=Heritrix,name=hi5-meetup-20070426221727670,type=CrawlService.Job 
importUri=http://seed/,true,true

In practice, I find #2 a lot easier.

Mike
